remarks: Lemma for ~ cantnf .  Here we show existence of Cantor normal forms.  Assuming (by transfinite induction) that every number less than ` C ` has a normal form, we can use ~ oeeu to factor ` C ` into the form ` ( ( A ^o X ) .o Y ) +o Z ` where ` 0 < Y < A ` and ` Z < ( A ^o X ) ` (and a fortiori ` X < B ` ).  Then since ` Z < ( A ^o X ) <_ ( A ^o X ) .o Y <_ C ` , ` Z ` has a normal form, and by appending the term ` ( A ^o X ) .o Y ` using ~ cantnfp1 we get a normal form for ` C ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2015.)
statement:
cantnfs.s $e |- S = dom ( A CNF B ) $.
cantnfs.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. On ) $.
cantnfs.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. On ) $.
oemapval.t $e |- T = { <. x , y >. | E. z e. B ( ( x ` z ) e. ( y ` z ) /\ A. w e. B ( z e. w -> ( x ` w ) = ( y ` w ) ) ) } $.
cantnf.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. ( A ^o B ) ) $.
cantnf.s $e |- ( ph -> C C_ ran ( A CNF B ) ) $.
cantnf.e $e |- ( ph -> (/) e. C ) $.
cantnf.x $e |- X = U. |^| { c e. On | C e. ( A ^o c ) } $.
cantnf.p $e |- P = ( iota d E. a e. On E. b e. ( A ^o X ) ( d = <. a , b >. /\ ( ( ( A ^o X ) .o a ) +o b ) = C ) ) $.
cantnf.y $e |- Y = ( 1st ` P ) $.
cantnf.z $e |- Z = ( 2nd ` P ) $.
cantnf.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. S ) $.
cantnf.v $e |- ( ph -> ( ( A CNF B ) ` G ) = Z ) $.
cantnf.f $e |- F = ( t e. B |-> if ( t = X , Y , ( G ` t ) ) ) $.
cantnflem3 $p |- ( ph -> C e. ran ( A CNF B ) ) $.
